snippet: The threat that his teams might be taken away is fading, and Benson has gone back to work, not slipped into an emeritus role, the way owners his age might be expected to do.
abstract: New Orleans Saints and New Orleans Pelicans owner Tom Belson is conducting business as usual after winning court battle with his daughter, who, along with her children, tried to declare him mentally unfit after he announced that his third wife would inherit the teams; ruling is being appealed, but threat that teams will be taken away is fading.
lead_paragraph: The threat that his teams might be taken away is fading, and Benson has gone back to work, not slipped into an emeritus role, the way owners his age might be expected to do.

headline.main: At 88, Tom Benson Conducts Business as Usual for New Orleans Teams
headline.print_headline: At 88, Benson Conducts Business as Usual for New Orleans Teams
